alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 7:13PM CST until March 01 at 3:36PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Marengo, Sumter and Hale Counties. .Flooding continues on the Tombigbee River and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by Friday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 68.0 feet, Flooding of lowlands in the area occurs and cattle should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Thursday the stage was 65.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 72.1 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 68.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
